author: Liang, Zhang & Li (2007)
notes: Liang Min, Zhang Junru & Li Yunbing (2007).  Pubiao-yu Yanjiu.  Beijing: The Ethnic Publishing House.Known as Pu Péo people/language in Vietnam.Known as Pŭ Biāo language in China; people classified as Yi (Lolo).(Following notation in the book:)Ch=aspirated plosive/affricate/fricative (IPA used in the book, but here:)hN=voiceless nasal; ṣȥ= retroflex; ćñ=alveolo-palatal; VV=long vowel; ɰ = unrounded high back vowel
problems: Liang+Zhang and Li worked with different speakers (mostly members of the same extended family); Liang+Zhang and Li may use different notations, e.g. minor syllables may be written as Ca33, Ca0 or Cə0.
